summary: A forwarded email from September 29, 2010, in which an unnamed individual writes to an unnamed recipient, referencing a prior meeting and requesting a place to stay during an upcoming trip to New York City in October 2010. The sender also inquires if 'team Epstein' will be in Paris that weekend, indicating a connection to Jeffrey Epstein's circle.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The sender inquires if 'team Epstein' will be in Paris during a specific weekend, indicating the recipient is associated with or has knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein's travel plans.

connections.description: The email is addressed to an unnamed recipient, and the sender inquires about 'team Epstein,' suggesting the recipient is connected to or part of Jeffrey Epstein's social or travel circle.
The sender states it was lovely to meet the recipient recently and believes they may have met before, indicating an existing social acquaintance.
The sender inquires about the whereabouts of 'team Epstein,' suggesting the sender is familiar with or seeking connection to Epstein's associates.

events.title: Sender's Planned Trip to NYC
events.description: The unnamed sender informs the recipient of plans to be in New York City from October 15 through October 21, 2010, and requests a place to stay.

events.title: Potential Weekend in Paris
events.description: The sender mentions possibly coming to Paris 'this weekend' (relative to the email date of September 29, 2010) and inquires if 'team Epstein' will still be there.

keyFacts: The document is a personal email discussing travel plans and lodging requests, indicating social connections within Jeffrey Epstein's network.
The sender uses the term 'team Epstein,' suggesting an organized group or entourage associated with Jeffrey Epstein was a known concept among his associates.
The email is dated September 29, 2010, which is after Epstein's 2008 conviction, indicating continued activity and travel within his social circle.
The document is marked 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' and contains redactions, indicating it was part of legal proceedings where certain information was shielded.
